(646) 798-4121

Text us to connect with the MIT peer support network!

Lean On Me automatically and anonymously matches peers to create a crowd-sourced texting network of instantaneous support across organizations.


Become A Supporter

Follow our blog
Frequently Asked Questions
How do I use this service?

Just text the problem you'd like to talk about to our hotline +16467984121. Our algorithms will match you with an available peer supporter who can relate to your challenges. Once you're successfully paired, you can have continue texting our hotline to have a private conversation with your supporter.
Who are the peer supporters?

Supporters are pre-vetted MIT students who share our vision for a healthier, happier campus. We have an extensive matching algorithm that ensures that we are able to find you supporters who have shared similar experiences.
Is the service anonymous?

Yes. The service is 100% anonymous, so unless you explicitly disclose your identity during a conversation, the peer supporter will never know who you are. We never ask for your name, and your phone number is never shared with anyone.
How do I end my conversation?

You can end a conversation with a supporter at any time by texting "\end" to our hotline. You should receive a confirmation text message from our server indicating that your communication channel was successfully terminated.
Are my conversations saved?

Never. Your privacy is extremely important to us, and as such, we will never save your conversations on our servers. In fact, your conversations will never hit a server hard drive, so you can be confident that the only person who will ever read your messages is your matched peer supporter or, in the case of a complaint, a Lean On Me administrative team member.
What if I have a poor experience?

If at any time you feel uncomfortable with your peer supporter, text "\flag" to our hotline. This will immediately end the conversation and forward your supporter's messages to a Lean On Me administrative team member. If we determine that a supporter has acted in poor taste, they will no longer be allowed to participate in the network.
Why are my messages blocked?

If a number is found to be the source of multiple spam incidents, we reserve the right to block the number from participating in the network. If you believe your number has been blocked in error, please feel free to drop us a line at leanonme-exec@mit.edu.
How can I help?

We're always looking for more people to join the team! If you're interested in applying to be a peer supporter, please submit an application here. If you'd like to be part of the Lean On Me organizational team or software development squad, please email us at leanonme-interest@mit.edu
Can I give you feedback?

Feedback is always welcome! If you have a suggestion, please drop us a line at leanonme-exec@mit.edu. We are constantly thinking about how to improve the Lean On Me network and technology, so we would love to hear from you.
We are a team of peer support enthusiasts from MIT who have spent years dealing with stress and poor lifestyle choices. Now we are ready to build the future of positive peer support communication networks.


Andy Trattner
Head of Growth and Marketing

Andy is a Computer Science and AeroAstro student at MIT who hopes to fundamentally change the way students thrive on college campuses all over the country. He's a marketing genius and unrelenting hustler who's ready to build university peer support networks on massive scales.


Linda Jing
Head of Operations

Linda is a Materials Science and Engineering student at MIT who is passionate about mental health and sustainability. She's an operations wizard who is responsible for managing our large team of peer supporters and spearheading our efforts in improving mental health on campus.


Nikhil Buduma
Head of Technology

Nikhil is a Computer Science student from MIT who is pursuing his Masters of Engineering at MIT CSAIL in artificial intelligence. He is the chief architect of the Lean On Me software platform and is excited to leverage AI technology to build smart peer support networks.
